verses.text:
The burden of the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* in the land of Hadrach , and Damascus \add shall be\add* the rest thereof: when the eyes of man , as of all the tribes of Israel , \add shall be\add* toward the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus , and Zidon , though it be very wise.
And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold , and heaped up silver as the dust , and fine gold as the mire of the streets.
Behold, the Lord will cast her out , and he will smite her power in the sea ; and she shall be devoured with fire.

Ashkelon shall see \add it\add*, and fear ; Gaza also \add shall see it\add*, and be very sorrowful , and Ekron ; for her expectation shall be ashamed ; and the king shall perish from Gaza , and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod , and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

And I will take away his blood out of his mouth , and his abominations from between his teeth : but he that remaineth , even he, \add shall be\add* for our God , and he shall be as a governor in Judah , and Ekron as a Jebusite.\f + \fr 9.7 \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*

And I will encamp about mine house because of the army , because of him that passeth by , and because of him that returneth : and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes. \p

¶ Rejoice greatly , O daughter of Zion ; shout , O daughter of Jerusalem : behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he \add is\add* just , and having salvation ; lowly , and riding upon an ass , and upon a colt the foal of an ass.\f + \fr 9.9 \ft having…: or, saving himself\f*

And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim , and the horse from Jerusalem , and the battle bow shall be cut off : and he shall speak peace unto the heathen : and his dominion \add shall be\add* from sea \add even\add* to sea , and from the river \add even\add* to the ends of the earth.
As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein \add is\add* no water.\f + \fr 9.11 \ft by…: or, whose covenant is by blood\f* \p
¶ Turn you to the strong hold , ye prisoners of hope : even to day do I declare \add that\add* I will render double unto thee;
When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim , and raised up thy sons , O Zion , against thy sons , O Greece , and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning : and the Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d* shall blow the trumpet , and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour , and subdue with sling stones ; and they shall drink , \add and\add* make a noise as through wine ; and they shall be filled like bowls , \add and\add* as the corners of the altar.\f + \fr 9.15 \ft with…: or, the stones of the sling\f*\f + \fr 9.15 \ft be…: or, fill both the bowls, etc\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people : for they \add shall be as\add* the stones of a crown , lifted up as an ensign upon his land.
For how great \add is\add* his goodness , and how great \add is\add* his beauty ! corn shall make the young men cheerful , and new wine the maids.\f + \fr 9.17 \ft cheerful: or, grow, or, speak\f*
